intro: Mariscus huttonii, commonly known as the Hutton's mariscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Mariscus huttonii is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments.
